channel.title: Mp3 to cassette
channel.description:
My girlfriend is away at her grandmothers for a while and me being the romantic that I am, figured I would make her a cassette mix tape to play on her grandmothers outdated technology.
Has anyone here ever written mp3s to cassettes? I googled it and found some obvious ways to do it, but I didn't know if anyone knew of a simple way to do it with technology I've already got, which is a cassette player, cassettes, and a computer.
Edit: this is actually much simpler than I thought it would be, 3.5mm output from my sound card goes right into the cassette input. derp

less ghetto niggers means less competition for noise

item.title: Mp3 to cassette
item.dc:creator: @Speljohan Speljohan
item.description:
@Speljohan wrote:

[quote=“Mopman, post:9, topic:411355”]Surely there must be a portable MP3 device with a battery life longer than a cassette deck, given that one has to turn a motor and the other doesn’t?[/quote]compare all the high end boomboxes today with the ones 30-40 years old

Read full topic

item.title: Mp3 to cassette
item.dc:creator: @bootnecklad bootnecklad
item.description:
@bootnecklad wrote:

BloodRayne:

Edit: this is actually much simpler than I thought it would be, 3.5mm output from my sound card goes right into the cassette input. derp

I think you went full derp.

Computer 3.5mm audio out -> cassette recorder input

[quote=“maniown, post:3, topic:411355”]1) Play music off computer or other music playing device
2) press record on tape player
3) ???
4) PROFIT!!![/quote]
THIS.

Read full topic

item.title: Mp3 to cassette
item.dc:creator: @Speljohan Speljohan
item.description:
@Speljohan wrote:

[quote=“R.I.P RSC, post:5, topic:411355”][quote author=Speljohan link=topic=512619.msg3720928#msg3720928 date=1313934932]
cassettes are superior in some situations. Take festivals for example. A typical 80’s boombox has a battery lifelength that is 10x the new ones, not to mention they are much louder.
[/quote]

But that’s like going to a brothel and fap.[/quote]No, generally you spend a lot of time on the camping grounds between bands.

Read full topic
